channel.title: World
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from World, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: One of two men freed in error hands himself back in as prison governors blame Tories for underfunding system – UK politics live
item.description: Billy Smith, 35, was sentenced to 45 months for multiple fraud offences on Monday and freed in error the same day David Lammy , the deputy PM and just...

item.title: Flooded UK coalmines could provide low-carbon cheap heat ‘for generations’
item.description: Report says proven technology could benefit thousands in poor quality housing and help UK meet carbon reduction targets Flooded disused coalmines coul...

item.title: What Tuesday’s elections mean for the future of abortion rights
item.description: Democrats’ commanding victories have breathed new life for supporters of the reproductive health fight Supporters of abortion rights have spent much o...

item.title: Bank of England holds interest rates at 4% ahead of make-or-break budget
item.description: Borrowing costs kept unchanged for second meeting in a row, with inflation at nearly twice official target Business live – latest updates Bank of Engl...

item.title: Senate to vote on legislation to stop unauthorized war against Venezuela – US politics live
item.description: Bipartisan proposal follows reports Trump administration is considering land strikes within the country As the US federal shutdown enters its second m...

item.title: Record referrals to Prevent anti-terror programme
item.description: The number of referrals to the scheme increased 27% in the year to March 2025, according to new data.

item.title: Miss Universe contestants stage walkout after organiser berates Miss Mexico
item.description: Miss Mexico, Fatima Bosch, said Nawat Itsaragrisil was 'not respectful' at a pre-pageant ceremony on Tuesday

item.title: UK facing long, tough flu season, NHS chiefs warn
item.description: Vulnerable urged to come forward for flu jab quickly as virus has come early this year.

item.title: Israel says Hamas returned body of dead Tanzanian hostage
item.description: Joshua Mollel, a 21-year-old agriculture student, was killed at Kibbutz Nir Oz during the Hamas-led 7 October 2023 attack on Israel.

item.title: Celebrity Traitors final briefly uploaded 24 hours early outside UK
item.description: The show was uploaded a day early by streaming service Crave in Canada, with hundreds able to watch.
